sentences.en: Eva stood up and indignation blazed in her eyes.
sentences.cn: 伊娃站了起来，眼睛里燃烧着愤怒。

sentences.en: He bristled with indignation at the suggestion that he was racist.
sentences.cn: 有人暗示他是个种族主义者，他对此十分恼火。

sentences.en: He stormed into her office, full of righteous indignation.
sentences.cn: 他义愤填膺，气呼呼地冲进她的办公室。

sentences.en: He was full of righteous indignation.
Local councillors have reacted with dismay and indignation.
sentences.cn: 地方政务委员的反应是惊恐和愤怒。

sentences.en: The news aroused the great indignation.
sentences.cn: 这消息激起了极大的愤慨.

sentences.en: The news roused discontent and indignation of the workers.
sentences.cn: 这消息激起了工人们的怨愤.
这消息激起了极大的义愤.

sentences.en: The proposal has provoked howls of Gallic indignation.
sentences.cn: 该提议令法国人义愤填膺。

sentences.en: The rise in train fares has aroused public indignation.
sentences.cn: 火车票提价激起了公愤。

sentences.en: Their rejection of these measures roused the people to indignation.
sentences.cn: 他们拒不采取这些措施,引起了人民的愤慨.

sentences.en: There followed a great flood of indignation in the newspapers.
sentences.cn: 随后,报纸连篇累牍地刊载了表示义愤的文章.

sentences.en: They were filled with righteous indignation.
They were full of righteous indignation at the thought of being cheated.
sentences.cn: 一想到受骗了他们就义愤填膺.

sentences.en: To his indignation, Charles found that his name was not on the list.
sentences.cn: 查尔斯发现他的名字没有出现在名单上，这让他深感愤慨。

trans.tran_en: feelings of anger and surprise because you feel insulted or unfairly treated
